name: Hilton Palacio del Rio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned home from San Antonio Texas with a stay at the Palacio del Rio right along the Riverwalk. This hotel is very clean, quiet, modern, with lovely spacious rooms, great air-conditioning, and lobby staff that were second to none. This is an excellent spot to stay to take in all of San Antonio's city attractions. Just step out the door and you are on the beautiful Riverwalk. What a fabulous treat this is with its brightly colored umbrellas, awesome restaurants and bars, neat shopping spots, and beautiful flowers and trees. Across the street is the huge Rivercentre Mall, 3 full floors of shopping, great food court, and very clean. Also just down the street is the historic Alamo, a very beautiful area of the city. Across from there is a street lined with entertainment for the younger crowd, while around the corner from that is the fabulous Buckhorn Saloon & Museum, for the older crowd. Right next door to the Palacio del Rio is the La Villita, a historic artisan shopping area. You will find many beautiful handmade crafts in this area, including paintings, pottery, leather goods, jewelry, etc. Also make sure to take in the El Mercado, a Mexican shopping area of the city, and it was fantastic! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel, and were so glad that it was so close to everything we wanted and needed to see... plus many more things that could be mentioned here. Also the hop on- hop off open-air top bus stops right outside, so it was easy to get around the city, if not by foot :) Enjoy, we sure did!
reviews.title: Excellent stay at Hilton Palacio del Rio

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel over the weekend. Being in the hotel business myself its hard to go to a location and not critic. This is a top notch hotel very modern. Great beds with feather pillows. Each room has its own balcony. The hotel has everything to offer, dirty nelly's (the bar in the hotel) was the best one we visited. On Saturdays there is a guy playing the piano who was awesome and got the whole bar involved. A job well done, the only thing I can say is the 40 per day parking is a bit ridiculous.
reviews.title: Best place and great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1st time in San Antonio & can't wait to go back! This hotel was clean modern and efficient. Loved the updated room. We stayed on the Riverwalk side and loved the balcony. While there is construction taking place, both in the hotel and across from the hotel, we didn't mind as the value of the room was affordable for the quality & location being directly on the Riverwalk. If I had one complaint it would be that they charge for parking for hotel guests.
reviews.title: Loved San Antonio

reviews.text: No complaints, well, except maybe that the sound-proofing is almost non-existent. People talking as they walked down the hall sounded like they were in your room. Aside from that, the staff were all very friendly and polite, the room decor was very updated and modern. Everything worked in tip-top shape. The A/C was very cold. Easy walking distance to the Alamo, the Alamodome, river walk is right outside. Definitely park on your own at the city-run garage between Commerce and Market since that's where they'll send you anyway and charge you at least $10 more a night for having done so. I skipped paying extra for a river walk view, and I think that was probably the better choice. I don't think the river view was worth much, plus if anything it was probably louder. I enjoyed the view of the Hemisfair tower anyway. I would definitely consider staying here again.
reviews.title: No complaints, great location, great stay

reviews.text: what a great hotel. great rooms, service from your staff very good. your transport guy anselmo was particularly helpful and his assistance is remembered. I was there for a nurses meeting. even tho construction was around, the lobby and indeed the whole hotel was very clean. everyone gave great directions.
reviews.title: my stay at the palacio hilton in san antonio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is exactly where you want to be along the main loop of the RiverWalk. The main entrance to the hotel is on the street level but they also have an entrance at the RiverWalk level and you can take an elevator from your hotel and be on the RiverWalk in seconds. One of the points where you can take the nice riverboat tours is right outside the building.
reviews.title: Great Location and Service
Would not stay again -Hilton Palacio del Rio
reviews.text: Stayed on the 9th floor and our room had a couch in it and mini fridge- not sure if all floors have that. Concierge gives you all types of certificates for appetizer freebies at local restaurants.

The exterior of the building is a little dated b/c it was built a while ago for the HemisFair, but it also has a cool history about it which you will learn on the riverboat tour. I noticed nothing dated about the interior of the lobby or our room. Both are nice with great views. All rooms have balconies. There are food options in the hotel but I would recommend enjoying some of the food options away from the hotel - as there are plenty, and I think more adequately priced than the restaurants in the hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing customer service!

reviews.text: Overall - fantastic location and great service from staff - can not stress enough how accessible and walkable the main attractions of SA are from the Hilton - RiverWalk, Alamo, Market Square, Tower of Americas.
reviews.title: Skip this hotel altogether

reviews.text: We are Hilton Honors members and our profile requests King, non-smoking, lower floor. I booked it with Hilton directly several weeks prior to our visit to San Antonio. We check in and all they have is a room on the 18th floor!! We try it, I can't handle the height, so the balcony does us no good. Then they move us to the 12th floor, with 2 double (not queen!) beds. Still too high. So much for a romantic get away. The room wasn't worth the price, no matter what floor we were on. What's happening to the Hilton brand?
reviews.title: Loved this hotel. Would want to return to it, definitely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathroom mirrors were hazy and dirty, so was the floor and tub not cleaned well. Watch out for those funky toilets that spit your stuff back at you all for the idea of being conservationists. Self Parking is off site and you still have to pay $25 a night unless you pull a ticket and park before the 5th level which costs $12; but you have no in and out privileges.Convenient to River Walk but not worth the hassel. Better off staying at Homewood Suites north of town. One very small hot tub; when referencing to front desk they say they do not have a heated spa, but the rules on the sign say "Spa" so they have a little uppity attitude. There were two couples in the spa and about 8 others wanting to get in and the look of disappointment as they arrived was very sad. The pool is not heated and they strictly enforce closure time. For such a large and bustling property they should at least have two spas, excuse me, hot tubs and don't even think of saying jacuzzi. The breakfast was very good and very expensive if you are not a preferred guest. Even with a gold status, there was confusion as to what could be ordered or conveniently accessed by the brunch buffet; their rules seemed silly and confusing. It's disgusting that they allow smoking right next to the indoor eating area because it is considered patio. No phone books in rooms. Some front desk staff were very patient and accommodating.
reviews.title: Overpriced and not worth the trouble

reviews.text: Stayed 20-24 Oct 2010, mainly for business. Check-in was a breeze - perhaps all of 2 mins.! The room was clean, air conditioning was good and quiet. If I had neighbors, I didn't know it. Got good nights rest. Bed was comfortable. Good view to look at in the morning with sunrise. Being on the riverwalk, it was step out into the flow and away you go. Good food and the weather was perfect this time of year. Caught the ALCS at the hotel's sports bar on the riverwalk. Nice crowd in there, given that the Texas Rangers were playing and won, that is! The only downer I experienced is that parking is expensive ($35.50. + tax/tip for valet and $22.+tax for self-park) and the garage is about a block away and on the 7-9th floors of the garage. Takes a while to get the car if you self park. Overall, the staff was very friendly and helpful - on par for Hilton hotels. I must say that my stay was excellent.
reviews.title: Great Stay - Excellent location

reviews.text: Stayed Oct. 21-24, 2010. It is a great location. Two minute walk to the Alamo and shopping mall. Little shops are next to hotel. Also it is just across the street from convention center. McDonalds is also a 2 minute walk. Right on River walk - restaurants, bars, and river boat ride just steps outside the hotel lower level. Room was average, but clean. We were on 20th floor river walk side but hard to see when you are up that high. If you want a good view, stay on the lower level rooms. Because of other reviews, I did self park in parking ramp for $12. It is a short walk at the end of same block across the street. Staff was friendly, but hard to understand,
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I would recommend it.
reviews.title: Great service in a great location by the fabulous Riverwalk

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in the middle of October on a work conference. We had catered breakfast and lunch at the hotel daily, which was excellent and very generous. The housekeeping was excellent, the concierge friendly and helpful, and the head customer service manager went out of her way to ensure I had a wonderful stay.
reviews.title: Loved Every Minute, Once We got Settled In!
Fun place to stay
reviews.text: The location and atmosphere added with the hotel upgrades makes this place a fun stay if your not wanting peacea and quiet but instead a good outdoor time.. I lived in San Antonio in the early 80's and the riverwalk wasn't as nice as it is now. This hotel needed an upgrade and it got it! Great job on the room redesigns. Especially the riverwalk view with KING bed.. Great balcony! Although, be careful. You can drop something over on top of folks walking by.

reviews.title: Excellent and Beautiful Hotel
reviews.text: Great experience from the staff to the hotel property. Was told the hotel was recently renovated and it surely did show in complete positive way. Love the fact the hotel has HHoners floor only. Never seen that before, pretty neat.

reviews.title: Hilton Palacio del Rio
reviews.text: Excellent hotel on the River Walk in San Antonio. Hotel Staff were friendly and helpful at all times. Hotel was nice and clean, even while at max capacity over the 4th of July weekend. Would stay at this hotel again.

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in a beautiful city!
reviews.text: Our church youth group recently stayed at this hotel for the National LCMS Youth Gathering, and everything was fantastic! The rooms were clean and offered LOTS of amenities - mini fridge, make-up mirror, and an easy-to-use safe. The building was recently remodeled - and it's gorgeous! It offers an exit directly onto the Riverwalk and it's centrally located to many of the area attractions including the Tower of the Americas, the Alamo, Henry B. Gonzales Convention Center, Alamodome, Riverwalk, as well as LOTS of restaurants and shopping. We received convention pricing, so the value was great as well. Thanks Palacio del Rio for your part in our wonderful week in San Antonio!

reviews.title: Parking is a nightmare.
reviews.text: We stayed at the Palacio Del Rio July 12-14 for our anniversary. The hotel was nice, as we usually expect with Hilton hotels. Conveniently situated on the river walk, we especially enjoyed being able to walk right out and onto the riverwalk from the hotel. The rooms are fine, and surprisingly had a tiny refrigerator, and a safe. (We stayed at other Hiltons that did not have a frig.) We requested a river front room and that was really nice. Sitting on the balcony and looking down to watch the riverboat tours go by was great. We did not go to the pool although it looked inviting, as it was full of kids.

reviews.title: SUPER HOTEL
reviews.text: I had a choice of staying at the Hyatt, Marriott or this Hilton. I certainly made the right choice! The staff are WONDERFUL and professional and polite. They leave the guest wanting for nothing. The property is slated for a renovation this year, and I can hardly wait to see it when it is done. BTW, of the hotel choices that I had, I picked the Hilton because it is on the Riverwalk and the others are not. I visited the other 2 properties and they are newer, but do not feel nearly as comfortable as the Hilton in SAT. GREAT JOB and BIG thanks to ALL the staff at the Hilton. Room 1602 ROCKS!

reviews.title: Old, tired, little value with slow servce
reviews.text: As a Hilton Diamond member, the service I received was minimal without my usual room request. The front desk woman was totally bored and really didn't want me to interupt her. We had a balcony room on the 8th floor facing a huge green water tank and building construction. The water along this river bend is brown and gross. We ate breakfast at the restaurant which had a nice buffet - although the omelet chef kept burning the eggs. The main part of the river walk is close by and the Alamo is only a few blocks away. Be sure and give the valets at least 30 minutes to get your car - and be prepared to pay $35/day plus tax/tip to park your car. We'll pass on this Hilton and stay at the Marriott or Embassy Suties next time.

reviews.title: I would not suggest Hilton Palacio del Rio
reviews.text: The parking is Ridiculous and...oh yeah...you must valet at $35 per day. Then the off site parking is like two blocks for $20+ a day but there is no in and out priviledges. The hotel is old and need updating. It was my husband and I 1st wedding anniversary and our room was not a view of the riverwalk it was not what we expected for our first time on the Riverwalk.

reviews.title: Wow! $38 overnight valet parking?
reviews.text: Got a good room rate at last minute and the staff was very friendly and helpful. River view room on 21st floor with great view as requested. Rooms were fine (if a bit dated) and I understand they will be modernizing all guest rooms in 2011. Valet parking stub clearly states $35 (plus $3 tax) but I was too tired to look at it until we checked out. My fault. Next time will look into self-parking options.

reviews.title: Wonderful!
reviews.text: Overall a good deal at $69/night ($81 with tax) from a Priceline bid.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: Great location on the riverwalk and rooms are nice. No problems. Family had a great time and kids loved the pool on the rooftop! The elevators are the modern ones with no buttons inside and are very fast!
The beds are comfortable. The valet does get very busy and the parking can be tough but it's almost worth spending the overpriced 39 bucks. Almost.......
reviews.title: Great location!
Great place to stay!!
reviews.text: Not sure what else to say to fill up the 200 character minimum so just babbling now. Oh yeah I got the 2 nights with my Hilton points and there were zero problems cashing them in.

We stayed two night in July and can't say enough about the location. The Tower of the Americas and convention center are across the street. The riverwalk is also right outside the hotel and has a riverboat ticket stand across the street as well. This ticket stand location was obviously the best as our wait to buy tickets and get on boat (also few steps away from hotel) was about 30 minutes or less, while other locations (we're told by boat driver, and seeing long lines at other locations) was up to 1 1/2 hour wait. Many restaurants a short walk from the hotel including Landrys. View from the room patio and the hotel pool were great. Kids enjoyed the pool. Rooms were very nice and clean. Starbucks drinks available on the first floor gift shop. Only gripe was the daily cost of valet parking, which is to be expected in a large city. Overall, great place to stay.
reviews.title: Nice Rooms and Location

reviews.text: In town for a math teacher's convention we had a great place to stay at the Hilton. Across from the convention center and close to the mall making it convenient for business. Right on the River Walk making it GREAT for the night life of San Antonio. To hotel staff was vey courteous and helpful from checkin to checkout. The security guard resolved our room key problem quickly and politely. The rooms were very well done, comfortable and stylish. We really enjoyed the balcony in evening. There are three bars in the hotel, one is sure to meet your needs. Look forward to staying here again!!
reviews.title: Wonderful Get a Way
A wonderful experience overall!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton from Dec 23rd thru Dec 27th. We loved staying at the Hilton. Our room was on the 12th floor, kingsize bed with a riverview that was very nice. We liked that we had a balcony even though the weather was cold, we could still go out on the balcony and enjoy the beautitul Christmas lights on the riverwalk. Our room was spotless. We thought the room was plenty big and thought the same about the bathroom. Did not find the bathroom too small at all as seen in previous comments, we like the "curved" shower rod. Also did not come across any stained carpets or worn furniture as seen in previous comments. We had a very nice room. Bed was probably the most comfortable hotel bed we have ever slept in. Had plenty of coffee, hot chocolate and hotel toiletries. The service at the hotel was very, very good. We did have a snafu with the hotel running our credit card twice upon check in causing us some undue stress. However, upon being notified of the situation, the hotel and the manager did everything possible to correct the error and in as timely a manner as they could. For our trouble, we were given vouchers for free breakfast for all four mornings of our stay plus a free dinner at their restaurant. We took advantage of these vouchers and thought the Ibiza restautrant was very nice. Our location on the riverwalk is excellent, cannot be beat. Overall, we had a wondeful stay at Christmastime in San Antonio. We would absolutely stay at this Hilton again. We loved it!

reviews.title: Dirty room and floating bath tub
reviews.text: I've stayed here before and they couldn't have been nicer. On this visit however, everyone except the valet was "cranky"/ rude. There are plenty of places to stay and this isn't the best bargain to be had.

reviews.title: Hotel-OK,Staff-nice,Location- Fab
reviews.text: The carpet is soiled and we found bits of paper like confetti around the floor. The bathtub, feels like a plastic tub was placed inside the real bathtub and it was bumpy and made my standing in the tub not secure.

reviews.title: Location!
reviews.text: The internet was not working properly and I had to hunt around the room looking for the TV remote (it wasn't next to the TV or the bedside table). The hotel was nearly cleared out from the holidays but I feel like I was given the worst room available.

reviews.title: Great Location, but a tired room
reviews.text: First let me say - there is nothing more beautiful than the Riverwalk at Christmas. The weather was 70 the 3 days we were there.The hotel is perfectly located so it is right on the water with great views but off the busiest part of the river as to avoid noise. I spent a lot of time on the balcony enjoying the lights.The room was not the greatest but far from the worst. There was a frige and coffee maker. The bath was nothing special but they did offer use of terry robes. The beds were a bit hard for my taste- usually hotels of this quality have fluffy spa-style beds-nothing special here. Again this hotel is all about location. Close to the Alamo,river center mall,fantastic food and night life. Dirty Nellies Pub is located downstairs on the river. I didn't go but it looked like a lot of folks liked it and were having a good time.The shopping is not what it once was but the atmosphere is still fab. There are riverboatride tours and handsome carriage rides beside the Alamo.One night we enjoyed a special treat-a lady playing Carols on a fiddle-how great. We did not rent a car this trip as we have visited the other sights and wanted to spend all our time on the riverwalk-plus the parking is very pricey. There is a airport shuttle service that serves all the downtown hotels. (The price was $60 roundtrip.) The hotel staff were very nice and the maids are very quiet in the morning.Again great location and a great visit.

We stayed at the Hilton for a weekend getaway and even though we've been to San Antonio a few times we've never stayed in the riverwalk area. The hotel was very clean with efficient modern elevators and modern rooms with balconies. We chose a city view room and had an impressive view of the downtown area and Tower of Americas. You can exit the hotel at the bottom level and your'e right on the riverwalk and a short distance to the rivercenter mall as well. It was only about 2 blocks from the Alamo & the Ripleys attractions we enjoyed. We traveled with kids and were about a 4 block walk to the Childrens Museum. We booked the rate with breakfast included and enjoyed the breakfast buffett. On Sunday there weren't any waffles offered on the buffett so I asked the waitress and she had one made for us at no additional cost. The restaurant staff and check-in staff were very friendly and we were also able to get an hour late check-out upon request. My only complaint is the valet parking. There was nothing special going on that weekend and we'd planned to valet but circled around twice and had to get in a long line that formed outside of the hotel drive through that blocked the neighboring street. It was like a parking lot! We opted to find our own parking instead and parked for two nights at a safe garage right across the street for only $30 for the weekend! That saved us about $60 in valet parking, tax & tip. Great stay and we'd definitely stay here again if we opt to stay downtown.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with a great location!

reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed in San Antonio at the Hilton Palacio Del Rio. I was so impressed with the staff's professionalism, the housekeeping work, the facilities, and the total experience. The beds are clean and very plush. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous! We will definitely be returning!
reviews.title: Hilton Palacio Del Rio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I actually stayed here twice, once in December 2012 and most recently in July 2013. Both times were of consistent quality, and I would highly recommend this hotel to others. I am pretty picky about where I stay and evaluating levels of service, but these guys have done an excellent job giving a fresh face to an older hotel. Additionally, the price point of this hotel is shocking compared to the quality. Such a fantastic bargain (other than the valet parking)!
reviews.title: Fantastic, modern hotel

reviews.text: I thought that the design of the hotel is very tasteful and modern, and each room looks like it was individually designed. Although both of our rooms were substantially similar, it felt like we were in an individually-designed room, rather than in a large corporate chain hotel room, which I hate. The beds were comfortable, the linens were top notch, and the cleanliness of the room was beyond reporach. I also really liked the super-modern bathrooms. The common areas of the hotel were also beautiful, clean and brought in a lot of the local flavor of San Antonio.
reviews.title: Just good since there was a problem

reviews.text: The breakfast was amazing. They were consistently busy both times we stayed there, but the staff at the restaurant are prompt, courteous and very professional. I was pleasantly surprised because they delivered 5-star service without a doubt.
reviews.title: Great location !

description: Explore San Antonio from the Hilton Palacio del Rio and enjoy our San Antonio hotel’s contemporary, hacienda style setting. Spectacularly situated on the banks of the famous San Antonio River Walk, this San Antonio hotel offers 485 Guest Rooms with private balconies and a range of thoughtful amenities including modern 37-inch HD TVs, high-speed internet access and a connectivity center. Unwind with a great night’s sleep in a comfy bed and admire breathtaking panoramas across San Antonio.
